case_title: K.P. NARAYAN APPA SETTY & CO vs COMMISSIONER OF INCOME TAX, A. P.
respondant: COMMISSIONER OF INCOME TAX, A. P.
complaint_summary: The case concerns whether penalty was exigible for the assessment year 1946-47 under the Indian Income-tax Act, 1922, given the inordinate delay in levying penalty.
investigation_summary: The assessee was assessed to tax for the year 1946-47, finalized on July 24, 1954. No penalty order was issued until July 1, 1963, a delay of nine years. The department provided no explanation for the delay.
judgment_summary: The court held that the penalty was not levied within a reasonable time, as per established legal principles. The reference was answered in the negative, and no costs were ordered.
punishment: No penalty levied due to inordinate delay.
legal_arguments: No period for levying penalty is fixed under the Indian Income-tax Act, 1922.
Penalty should be levied within a reasonable time.
Under the new Act, the prescribed period for penalty is two years after assessment completion.
Nine years elapsed without explanation for delay.
key_issues: Whether penalty was exigible for the assessment year 1946-47.
Reasonableness of delay in levying penalty.

legal_terms.exigible: Liable to be demanded or enforced.

summary_vector_notes: The judgment addresses the issue of penalty under the Indian Income-tax Act, 1922, emphasizing the importance of timely enforcement. The court ruled against the levy due to a nine-year delay without justification.
